page.title: 19Religion
page.content: The only place of worship in the area is Stanford Bishop church. This is a small late Norman church situated in a large churchyard with many old yew trees. The church stands on a hill, the highest point in the parish, it has no houses near it being almost surrounded by blackcurrants and hops. The churchyard is circular which is thought to indicate pre-Christian use as a sacred site. In the church is an old chair thought to have been used by St.Augustine when he met Welsh bishops in 603 at Stanford Bishop. To test him the Welsh bishops arranged for Augustine to arrive first and be seated in the chair. As he did not rise to greet them they distrusted him and returned home. Experts doubt whether this meeting was held at Stanford Bishop or that the chair was made earlier than the late middle ages
